body:
When 'confirm' is set and there are unsaved buffers,
:restart now prompts before quitting, matching the behavior of :quit.

Fixes https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/36499

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -378,6 +378,14 @@ describe('TUI :restart', function()
     tt.feed_data('C\013')
     screen:expect({ any = vim.pesc('[No Name]') })
 
+    -- Check :restart respects confirm

comment_data.body: This doesn't look right. `confirm qall` will call `check_changed_any()` again, but `check_changed_any()` is already called here.

my understanding is the first call checks if the user has aborted the confirm, the second one, done by the quit_cmd checks is more so geared if the caller passes in a command which won't quit the server so it errors w/ `restart failed: +cmd did not quit the server`

Wouldn't `:restart +qall` also run `check_changed_any()` twice?
Hmm wait. Actually the previous `check_changed_any()` should have already marked the remaining buffers as unchanged, so adding `:confirm` won't do anything.
yeah you're right. we could switch back to the ternary but with `qall` instead of `qall!` if that's preferred. I don't really get why `qall!` so not sure if to keep that
let's start with the minimal change. can discuss switching the default in a separate issue/pr

comment_regular_data.body: @justinmk. Anything else needed from me here?
